{"step_by_step_thinking": "The term 'Q test' can refer to different statistical tests depending on the context. However, based on the provided documents, the Q test is primarily used for identifying outliers (Dixon's Q test, as mentioned in Document [4]) and for comparing the effectiveness of treatments (Cochran's Q test, as mentioned in Document [11]). There is no mention of the Q test being used to determine normality distribution or to compare the proportion of means of 2 or more groups.", "answer_choice": "B"}
